intro: Hypodematium hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy hypodematium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, a typical feature of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
